project.teaser: EOSC Focus will support the co-programmed EOSC Partnership in delivering its mission of establishing Open Science as the “new normal” and achieving the key objectives, which are outlined in the Memorandum of Understanding between the European Union and the EOSC Association...
project.objective:
EOSC Focus will support the co-programmed EOSC Partnership in delivering its mission of establishing Open Science as the “new normal” and achieving the key objectives, which are outlined in the Memorandum of Understanding between the European Union and the EOSC Association (EOSC-A).
EOSC Focus is a collaboration of eight Members of EOSC-A and the EOSC Association AISBL itself – the hub of key stakeholders in the European research environment, which provides insights on overarching themes important for the realisation of EOSC. The consortium demonstrates excellent complementarity across the diverse regions and stakeholder groups needed to ensure appropriate coverage of countries and stakeholders.
EOSC Focus will provide an effective EOSC stakeholder forum; consolidate and enhance existing monitoring frameworks; identify strategic gaps to inform future iterations of the SRIA; develop and test resourcing models for a sustainable EOSC; implement the EOSC Rules of Participation; and collaborate with other EOSC-related projects, other partnerships, and international initiatives.
EOSC Focus is organised into six work packages: WP 1 Project Coordination; WP 2 Stakeholder Engagement and Management; WP 3 SRIA Update and Technical Development; WP 4 Monitoring and Impact Assessment, WP 5 Sustainability of EOSC, and WP 6 Communication, Dissemination & Stakeholder Forum. The combination of these work packages will help the sometimes divergent activities of the broader stakeholder community to focus on the big goal of delivering EOSC.
The impact of EOSC Focus will contribute to the increased availability, accessibility, and re-use of data. It will make research results more accessible for citizens; it will increase the quality and outreach of science and thus lead to more results from science and its innovation up-take.
project.title: EOSC Focus
project.keywords: open science, EOSC, collaboration, shared resources, stakeholder engagement

result.title: Annual report published by the EOSC-A & monitoring framework revision (second release)
result.description: This report will collect data from EOSC ecosystem stakeholders, which serve as a basis for evaluating progress towards EOSC objectives through periodic monitoring of delivered KPIs and contributions to the AAP. The report will also include a revision of the KPI framework.

result.title: Selection of KPIs to be reported by HE projects
result.description: The initial set of KPIs to be reported by the EOSC Partnership includes 53 items, not all of which will be relevant for HE Projects. The project will monitor the KPIs reported by the HE Projects to the EC and, based on that, in order to avoid any overlapping of reporting, will select a limited set of most relevant indicators for monitoring the development of the EOSC ecosystem.

result.title: Strategic Research and Innovation Agenda (SRIA) update
result.description: The multi-annual SRIA update will provide the basis for the development of co-operation under the EOSC Partnership, and for defining annual priorities in line with the Strategic Plan for Horizon Europe.

result.title: Annual report published by the EOSC-A & monitoring framework revision (third release)
result.description: This report will collect data from EOSC ecosystem stakeholders, which serve as a basis for evaluating progress towards EOSC objectives through periodic monitoring of delivered KPIs and contributions to the AAP. The report will also include a revision of the KPI framework.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The DMP will explain how EOSC Focus will handle data in its operations in a secure, GDPR-compliant and FAIR way.

result.title: Engagement Activities Review
result.description: This document provides an overview of the engagement activities performed by the project and their resulting impact. It builds on the Rolling Engagement Plan and on M2.1 and M2.2 in which engagement activities have been periodically assessed.

result.title: Strategic Research and Innovation Agenda (SRIA) of the European Open Science Cloud (EOSC) Version 1.1

result.title: Technical Collaboration Report with other European Partnerships and relevant initiatives
result.description: These reports by EOSC-A will be specific to its collaboration with other European Partnerships (Partnership Memorandum of Understanding)

result.title: Annual report published by the EOSC-A & monitoring framework revision (first release)
result.description: This report will collect data from EOSC ecosystem stakeholders, which serve as a basis for evaluating progress towards EOSC objectives through periodic monitoring of delivered KPIs and contributions to the AAP. The report will also include a revision of the KPI framework.

result.title: Report in the form of the half-yearly digest on EOSC technical activities following the ETCC
result.description: EOSC project digests to keep up-to-date with merged information from EOSC projects and the big picture regarding the technical EOSC ecosystem.

result.title: Resourcing models
result.description: Report providing an overview of suitable models for cost-estimation, funding and pricing of the development and operation of OS service provision, that contribute to long-term service availability. This will also include early results on the contributions of the MS/ACs and national EOSC structures to EOSC, and on improvement to RoP to support sustainability.

result.title: Project Quality and Risk Management Plan
result.description: This document will define the framework and mechanisms to ensure that the objectives of the project are met.

result.title: Strategic Research and Innovation Agenda (SRIA) of the European Open Science Cloud (EOSC) Version 1.2
Sustainability status and plans/issues for future work
result.description: A handover plan to build in sustainability after the end of the current project, with sections on each of the WP5 tasks. To include a plan for (i) RoP evolution and monitoring, (ii) best practices for collaboration on OS service provisioning in an expanding ecosystem, (iii) an overview of relevant resourcing models, and (iv) support for public bodies in advancing collaboration towards a global interoperability framework and an Open Science Commons.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
